required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Quintex® Follow-up After One Year Minimum
clinical_study.official_title: Prospective Follow-up Study of the Aesculap Quintex® Anterior Cervical Plating System After a Minimum of One Year

brief_summary.textblock: Prospective study, not randomised, non-interventional, monocentric, investigating an intended patient cohort of 60 patients already operated on the cervical spine due to degenerative disc disease of the cervical spine down to the first thoracolumbar VBR (C2-T1), who received a Quintex plate for stabilisation

primary_outcome.measure: Clinical Results measured by Neck Disability Index (NDI)
primary_outcome.time_frame: One retrospective visit, between one and approx. five years post-op.
primary_outcome.description: The NDI is designed to measure neck-specific disability. The questionnaire has 10 items to measure patient-reported disability secondary to neck pain and activities of daily living including personal care, lifting, reading, headaches, concentration, work status, driving, sleeping and recreation and patients rate their status from 0 (best) to 5 (worst imaginable). Individual item responses are summed to a total score, where 0 points indicate no activity limitations and 50 points indicate complete activity limitation.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: One retrospective visit, between one and approx. five years post-op.
secondary_outcome.description: Visual analogue scale for pain: The visual analogue scale (VAS) is a scale used to determine the pain intensity experienced by individuals. It consists of a line, approximately 10-15 cm in length, with the left side signifying no pain with a smiling face image and the right side signifying the worst pain ever with a frowning face image.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: One retrospective visit, between one and approx. five years post-op.
secondary_outcome.description: Patient satisfaction with Outcome of surgery documented in two aspects: is the Patient satisfied (four Point scale: very satisfied, satisfied, unsatisfied, very unsatisfied) and would the Patient like to undergo surgery again (yes, no, not willing to say)

secondary_outcome.measure: Quality of life measured by EQ-5D-5L
secondary_outcome.time_frame: One retrospective visit, between one and approx. five years post-op.
secondary_outcome.description: The descriptive system comprises five dimensions: mobility, self-care, usual activities, pain/discomfort and anxiety/ depression. Each dimension has 5 levels: no problems, slight problems, moderate problems, severe problems and extreme problems. The patient is asked to indicate his/her health state by ticking the box next to the most appropriate statement in each of the five dimensions. This decision results in a 1-digit number that expresses the level selected for that dimension. The digits for the five dimensions can be combined into a 5-digit number that describes the patient's health state.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: One retrospective visit, between one and approx. five years post-op.
secondary_outcome.description: Bazaz score: The Bazaz Dysphagia Score is one criterion used to define dysphagia; it classifies dysphagia as severe, moderate, mild, or none

secondary_outcome.time_frame: One retrospective visit, between one and approx. five years post-op.
secondary_outcome.description: Adverse Events and Serious Adverse Events, reoperations and revisions rates

secondary_outcome.time_frame: One retrospective visit, between one and approx. five years post-op.
One retrospective visit, between one and approx. five years post-op.
secondary_outcome.description: Radiologically: Fusion status, plate position, pot. migration of screws and plate, radiolucent lines

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- all patients who received a Quintex® Anterior Cervical Plate since 2014 until approx. end 2018 (minimum Follow-up is one year) in the study center
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patient informed consent not signed
- Patients living outside a radius of 80 km around the study center
